preface.title: Preface
preface.para: OpenStack Compute is a compute service that provides server capacity in the cloud. Compute Servers come in different flavors of memory, cores, disk space, and CPU, and can be provisioned in minutes. Interactions with Compute Servers can occur programmatically via the OpenStack Compute API.
This document describes the features available with API v2.
We welcome feedback, comments, and bug reports at bugs.launchpad.net/nova.

section.title: Intended Audience
section.para: This guide assists software developers who want to develop applications by using the OpenStack Compute API. To use this information, you should have access to an account from an OpenStack Compute provider, and you should also be familiar with the following concepts:
